info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:49PM EDT until June 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL SOUTHAMPTON...SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...SUSSEX... SOUTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES... At 449 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Disputanta to near Stony Creek to near Purdy, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Disputanta and Sussex around 455 PM EDT. Waverly and Homeville around 505 PM EDT. Wakefield and Dendron around 520 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Booth Fork, Carsley, Gray, Newville, Booker, Reams, Yale, Lumberton, Manry and Wharfs Store. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
